newsitem.title: USA: Appalachian Power files for $75 mln in notes.
newsitem.headline: Appalachian Power files for $75 mln in notes.

text.p: Appalachian Power filed Wednesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $75 million in junior subordinated deferred interest debentures, Series A, due 2026.
The unit of American Electric Power, said net proceeds will be used to refund cumulative preferred stock.
The Roanake, Va.,-based company said the offering will be made through Merrill Lynch & Co, Dean Witter Reynolds Inc, Lehman Brothers, PaineWebber Inc and Prudential Securities.
The notes mature September 30, 2026, the filing said.
